text: Share Tweet Email Copy Link Copied Series finales have a tendency to lean too heavily on sentiment or nostalgia to say goodbye to characters preparing to live on forever in syndication or in a more bingeable form on a streaming platform. Before that can happen, however, the series actually has to reach its conclusion, and be judged based on the merits of its finale, as New Girl has done after seven seasons on FOX. Some series, like M. A. S. H. or Cheers, ended in such a way as to be considered in the upper echelons of series finales. The shows are seemingly looked at even more fondly on the basis of having “ stuck the landing. ” And then there ’ s the finale of Seinfeld, which most viewers resound
